The client, who is mostly at home, relies on his home phone (corded) as his primary means of communication. It allows him to stay connected with his brother and the outside world, offering reassurance and the ability to seek help when needed. With the phone now damaged, he is distressed about being unable to communicate, especially in situations requiring assistance. Restoring this vital lifeline would significantly benefit his safety and well-being.

The client does not have a mobile phone as there are concerns he may engage in actions that compromises his own safety.
